Hi Mike,

Congrats on getting into the program at Sussex.  Thanks for the update
and good luck in your research.  Please keep us posted on what you end
up doing.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "gerbopel" <redcrocodile@h...> wrote:
> Hello everyone,
> 
> As a little refresher: This year I wrote a BSc (Hons) dissertation
> using a modified implementation of WinNEAT to evolve predatory agents
> for a one-on-one advanced Prey Capture scenario:
> 
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/message/1905
> http://www.redcrocodile.net/source/dissertation.php
> 
> I had never done any work with neuroevolution or NEAT before and
> several members of this group were extremely helpful and forthcoming
> with advice on several occasions when I felt lost and confused.
> 
> I finally received my results, and I did very well, so I just wanted
> to thank everyone for their input and for helping me as they did. 
> So... Thanks a lot :)
> 
> On another note, on the advice of Julian I visited the University of
> Sussex (in Brighton) and applied to their MSc Evolutionary and
> Adaptive Systems programme.  I was very impressed with the staff,
> facilities and the programme itself.  It seems like the logical next
> step for someone who's interested in pursuing all the topics that Ken
> intends to focus on at UCF.  I was accepted several weeks ago and if
> no fantabulous job opportunities present themselves in the next two
> months then I'll probably end up heading off to Brighton in October. 
> This, of course, will all be in preparation for applying to UCF to do
> a PhD under Ken and his newly formed crew of intellectual giants ;)
> 
> Anyway, just wanted to say thanks and let everyone know that their
> advice has helped me significantly in identifying the directions that
> I want my academic/professional career to go in.
> 
> Cheers,
> Mike
